channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Productivity gains fuel U.S. growth while hiring slows
item.description: EY Chief Economist Gregory Daco says businesses are generating growth with fewer workers and rising efficiency.

item.title: Mattel’s latest Barbie to celebrate diversity has autism
item.description: Mattel Inc. is introducing an autistic Barbie on Monday as the newest member of its line intended to celebrate diversity , joining a collection that a...

item.title: Molson Coors CEO: We’re doing our part to solve society’s ‘occasion problem’ – and we’re getting some unexpected help
item.description: Actor Christopher Walken is on board for our new Miller Lite campaign because these days, we could all use more “Legendary Moments.”

item.title: Federal Reserve Chair Powell Says DOJ Investigation Isn’t Really About Misusing Tax Payer Funds
item.description: Powell adds that it’s the result of a power struggle between the Fed and President.

item.title: A New Employee Missed a Work on Day 4, No Reason Given
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.

item.title: When Design Reflects the Business it Supports
item.description: What a long-term partnership reveals about alignment, timing, and growth

item.title: What was the metaverse?
item.description: Late last year, Meta confirmed it would effectively be abandoning the metaverse , a nebulously defined project that spurred the company’s 2021 rebrand...

item.title: The Remarkably Simple 5-Word Question LEGO Asks Before Building Anything New
item.description: An interview with Tom Donaldson, LEGO Group’s SVP of Creative Play Lab, on how the company came up with its new SMART Brick.

item.title: Trump signals plans for ExxonMobil in Venezuela after White House meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump said Sunday that he is “inclined” to keep ExxonMobil out of Venezuela after its top executive was skeptical about oil investmen...

item.title: This Founder Was Nearly Homeless After 3 Failed Startup Ideas. Then He Built a $150 Million Business
item.description: His story is a masterclass in pulling off a pivot.

item.title: How luxury homebuilding giant Toll Brothers took the drama out of CEO succession
item.description: The Fortune 500 company offers a masterclass in CEO hand-offs.

item.title: 5 ways to live a luckier life, starting tomorrow
item.description: Where success is concerned—in whatever way you choose to define success —effort matters. So does skill . Experience. Perseverance . A willingness to d...

item.title: Jeff Bezos tells Gen Z entrepreneurs to gain work experience before launching new companies: ‘I started Amazon when I was 30’
item.description: The Amazon founder reminds Gen Z that Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates are the exception.

item.title: A cautionary Hollywood tale: the Ellisons’ lose-lose Paramount positioning

item.title: Vibe coding is turning reporters into builders, and that’s a good thing for media
item.description: I teach AI to editorial and PR teams for a living, and if there’s one thing that excites and engages them more than any other, it’s vibe coding . The ...
